job_description: TRIUMFCanada's National Laboratory for Particle and Nuclear Physics STUDENT JOB PROGRAM Summer 2015 job posting Job number TR15-2-8Student job title:     Proton Therapy Research AssistantName of project:     Improving beam line elements for proton therapyOverview:     Since 1995, TRIUMF is operating Canada's only Proton-Therapy Facility.     The facility is operated in conjunction with the BC Cancer Agency and     the UBC Department of Ophthalmology and since its beginning 182     patients with ocular melanomas have been treated.         We are investigating the possibility to improved beam line elements of     the facility, which will directly improve the quality of the cancer     treatment.Duties:     The successful candidate will assist in the modeling of the facility     to establish the best design. He/she will then be responsible for     making drawings, seeing to the manufacturing of the elements as well     as assembly. He/she will also gather data with the new elements and     analyze the results.Skills learned during this work experience:     Basic knowledge in medical physics will be acquired. Mechanical     skills, drawing skills, simulation skills, design skills, and project     management skills will be improved or learned.TRIUMF is located on the campus of the University of British Columbia.For more information, visit our web site http://www.triumf.ca
job_requirements: Qualifications:     The successful candidate must have a background in physics or     engineering physics.
